name: f19f8
probTex: Let $f$ be an entire function and let $a,b\in\mathbb{C}$ with $|a|<R$ and $|b|<R$. If $\gamma(t)=Re^{it}, 0\leq t\leq2\pi$, evaluate\n\[\int_\gamma\frac{f(z)}{(z-a)(z-b)}dz.\]\nUse this result to give another proof of Liouville's Theorem.
solnTex:
First we rewrite the function $ rac{f(z)}{(z-a)(z-b)}$ as $f(z)(a-b)\left( rac{1}{z-a}- rac{1}{z-b}ight)$ to justify evaluating the integral(s)
\[\int_\gamma f(z)(z-a)\left( rac{1}{a-b}- rac{1}{z-b}ight)dz=(a-b)\left(\int_\gamma rac{f(z)}{z-a}dz-\int_\gamma rac{f(z)}{z-b}dzight).\]
By Cauchy's integral formula these yield
\[=(a-b)(f(a)-f(b)).\]
On the other hand, an estimate gives
\[\left|\int_\gamma rac{f(z)}{(z-a)(z-b)}dzight|\leq\int_\gamma rac{|f(z)|}{|z-a||z-b|}|dz|.\]
Suppose $f$ is globally bounded by $M$ in modulus. Then
\[|(a-b)(f(a)-f(b))|\leq\int_\gamma rac{M}{|z-a||z-b|}|dz|\]
\[\leq\int_\gamma rac{M}{(|z|-|a|)(|z|-|b|)}|dz|=\int_0^{2\pi} rac{M}{(R-|a|)(R-|b|)}Rdt= rac{2\pi RM}{(R-|a|)(R-|b|)}.\]
Now for the proof structure. Let $a,b\in\mathbb{C}$ and suppose $R>|a|+|b|$. Then, by the above calculations,
\[|f(a)-f(b)|\leq rac{2\pi RM}{|a-b|(R-|a|)(R-|b|)}.\]
Taking the limit as $R	o\infty$ (which we can do because $f$ is entire) shows $f(a)=f(b)$, which is only possible for all $a,b\in\mathbb{C}$ if $f$ is constant.
